jbt.execution.task.decorator
Class ExecutionInverter

java.lang.Object
  jbt.execution.core.ExecutionTask
      jbt.execution.task.decorator.ExecutionDecorator
          jbt.execution.task.decorator.ExecutionInverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITaskListener
public class ExecutionInverter
extends ExecutionDecorator

ExecutionInverter is the ExecutionTask that knows how to run a ModelInverter.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

Constructor Detail

ExecutionInverter

public ExecutionInverter(ModelTask modelTask,
                         BTExecutor executor,
                         ExecutionTask parent)
Creates an ExecutionInverter that is able to run a ModelInverter task and that is managed by a BTExecutor.

Parameters:
modelTask - the ModelInverter that this ExecutionInverter is going to run.
executor - the BTExecutor in charge of running this ExecutionInverter.
parent - the parent ExecutionTask of this task.

internalTick

protected ExecutionTask.Status internalTick()
Checks if the only child has already finished. If so, it inverts its status code. Otherwise, it returns Status#RUNNING.

Specified by:
internalTick in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
the status of the task after being ticked.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalTick()

restoreState

protected void restoreState(ITaskState state)
Does nothing.

Specified by:
restoreState in class ExecutionTask
Parameters:
state - an ITaskState object containing past state information that should be retrieved, or null in case there is no past information to remember.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.restoreState(ITaskState)

statusChanged

public void statusChanged(TaskEvent e)
Just calls ExecutionTask.tick() so that the ExecutionInverter can evolve according to the termination of its child.

Specified by:
statusChanged in interface ITaskListener
Specified by:
statusChanged in class ExecutionTask
Parameters:
e - the TaskEvent with all the information about the change in the status of the task.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.statusChanged(jbt.execution.core.event.TaskEvent)

storeState

protected ITaskState storeState()
Does nothing.

Specified by:
storeState in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
an ITaskState object with the persistent state information of the task, for future use. The returned ITaskState must be readable by restoreState().
